Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Finding/Finding by Site or System/Cardiovascular System Finding/Aneurysm/Intracranial Aneurysm
Cardiovascular Diseases/Vascular Diseases/Cerebrovascular Disorders/Intracranial Arterial Diseases/Intracranial Aneurysm
Record.Description: Abnormal outpouching in the wall of intracranial blood vessels. Most common are the saccular (berry) aneurysms located at branch points in CIRCLE OF WILLIS at the base of the brain. Vessel rupture results in SUBARACHNOID HEMORRHAGE or INTRACRANIAL HEMORRHAGES. Giant aneurysms (>2.5 cm in diameter) may compress adjacent structures, including the OCULOMOTOR NERVE. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p841)Outpouching of BASILAR ARTERY at the base of the skull. The basilar artery is the most important artery in the posterior cerebral circulation.
